intro: Anemopaegma longidens, commonly known as the long-stemmed anemopaegma, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. Anemopaegma longidens is often found in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories or along stream banks.
